p: Dipterocarp trees are confined to wet climates, with a dry season of 4 months and more abundant in aseasonal than seasonal climates (Ashton, 1988). However, the ecoregions for Sal and Garjan are restricted to monsoon tropics where water availability is seasonally limiting (mean rainfall of driest month < 50 mm; Corlett & Lafrankie, 1998): Significant climatic anomalies such as increasing temperature seasonality and drought conditions may affect the growth of these Dipterocarp trees.
